meaningMnemonic: What was the biggest <radical>hole</radical> in the <radical>construction</radical> of the world? The <kanji>sky</kanji>. If you think about it, the sky is like a big hole someone forgot to fill in. That's why this kanji also means <kanji>empty</kanji>! Makes sense — nothing is more empty than the sky.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>sky</kanji> is usually empty until clouds stage a <reading>coup</reading> (くう). Basically you can think of the sky as the site for one coup after another as the weather changes.
